nodes.name: Get advice articles from a Google search

parameters.content:
## 1. Get advice articles from a Google search**
Uses an HTTP request to perform a Google search for LinkedIn advice articles based on a predefined query.

## 2. Extract Article links for LinkedIn advice articles
This Code node extracts LinkedIn article URLs from the Google search results by using a regular expression. It pulls all article links related to LinkedIn advice.

## 3. Split Out all links for LinkedIn advice articles
Splits the list of extracted LinkedIn article links into individual items. This allows each article to be processed one at a time in the following steps.

nodes.name: Merge data and keep unique google search results
Extract Article links for LinkedIn advice articles
Split Out all links for LinkedIn advice articles

values.content:
=Read the following collaborative article and provide your own helpful collaboration. The article has various topics that each need to be answered. Write me a paragraph of helpful advice for each topic and format your response as outlined in the template below.

-------------
ARTICLE TITLE
{{ $json.ArticleTitle }}

TOPICS WITHIN THE LINKEDIN ARTICLE:
{{ $json.ArticleTopics }}

OTHER CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE LINKEDIN ARTICLE:
{{ $json.ArticleContributions }}
-------------

Your advice must be unique and something that no one else has recommended before on the article, or in any of the topics. The response needs to be raw and genuine to elicit conversation and engagement.

Format your output in text and follow the template below. Only populate the template with as many topics as were provided in the original request 

i.e: if there were only 4 topics in the original request then only provide 4 pieces of advice:

OUTPUT TEMPLATE

1. [Topic #1 from Article]
[Advice for Topic]

2. [Topic #2 from Article]
[Advice for Topic]

3. [Topic #3 from Article]
[Advice for Topic]

4. [Topic #4 from Article]
[Advice for Topic]

5. [Topic #5 from Article]
[Advice for Topic]

6. [Topic #6 from Article]
[Advice for Topic]

nodes.name: Post new LinkedIn contributions to Slack channel
Get all LinkedIn contributions from database NocoDB (GetRows)
HTML extract LinkedIn article & other users contributions
HTTP Request to get LinkedIn advice articles

parameters.content:
## What this workflow does
1. **`Triggers Weekly`**: The workflow is set to run every Monday at 8:00 AM.
2. **`Search Google for LinkedIn Advice Articles`**: Uses a predefined Google search URL to find the latest LinkedIn advice articles based on the user's area of expertise.
3. **`Extract LinkedIn Article Links`**: A code node extracts all LinkedIn advice article links from the search results.
4. **`Retrieve Article Content`**: For each article link, the workflow retrieves the HTML content and extracts the article title, topics, and existing contributions.
5. **`Generate AI-Powered Contributions`**: The workflow sends the extracted article content to an AI model, which generates unique, helpful advice for each topic within the article.
6. **`Post to Slack & NocoDB`**: The AI-generated contributions, along with the article links, are posted to a designated Slack channel and stored in a NocoDB database for future reference.

## Setup
1. **`Google Search URL`**: Update the Google search URL with the relevant LinkedIn advice query for your field (e.g., "site:linkedin.com/advice 'marketing automation'").

2. **`Slack Integration`**: Connect your Slack account and specify the Slack channel where you want the contributions to be posted.

3. **`NocoDB Integration`**: Set up your NocoDB project to store the generated contributions along with the article titles and links.

## Become A LinkedIn Top Voice with AI
Built for the [Let's Automate It Community](http://onlinethinking.io/community) by [Optimus Agency](https://optimus01.co.za/)

This workflow helps users maintain a consistent presence on LinkedIn by automating the discovery of new advice articles and generating unique contributions using AI. It is ideal for professionals who want to engage with LinkedIn content regularly without spending too much time manually searching and drafting responses.

## How to customize this workflow
- **`Change Search Terms`**: Modify the Google search URL to focus on a different LinkedIn topic or expertise area.
- **`Adjust Trigger Frequency`**: The workflow is set to run weekly, but you can adjust the frequency by changing the schedule trigger.
- **`Enhance Contribution Quality`**: Customize the AI model's prompt to generate contributions that align with your brand voice or content strategy.

## Get all LinkedIn contributions from database NocoDB (GetRows)
This node retrieves all LinkedIn contributions stored in a specified NocoDB table. It performs a "getAll" operation to fetch all rows from the

## Merge data and keep unique google search results
This node merges and filters the extracted article links, ensuring that only unique LinkedIn article URLs are processed. It prevents duplicate article links from being handled.

## 1. HTTP Request to get LinkedIn advice articles
Sends an HTTP request to retrieve the HTML content of each LinkedIn article link. This node fetches the actual web page content from LinkedIn articles.

## 2. HTML extract LinkedIn article & other users contributions
This node extracts relevant information from the HTML of LinkedIn articles, including the article title, topics discussed, and contributions made by other users.

## Post new LinkedIn contributions to Slack channel
Posts the AI-generated LinkedIn contributions to a specified Slack channel. This allows the contributions to be shared with a team or for record-keeping.

## Post new LinkedIn contributions to NocoDB (CreateRows)
Stores the AI-generated LinkedIn contributions in a NocoDB database. It saves the article title, link, and the contribution itself for future reference and tracking.
### `NocoDB` can be swapped with another service like `Airtable` or `Google Sheets`
### `NocoDB` can be swapped with another service like `Airtable` or `Google Sheets`

## LinkedIn Contribution Writer
Uses an AI model to generate unique contributions based on the extracted content from LinkedIn articles. The generated advice is tailored for each topic within the article.

## Tools That Are Interchangeable




### `NocoDB` can be swapped with another service like `Airtable` or `Google Sheets`

## Set Topic for Google search
This node sets a specific topic to be used in subsequent steps of the workflow.

parameters.text:
=Riassumi e fornisci il tuo contributo utile in maniera super sintetica per UN SOLO post LinkedIn.

Prendi spunto dall‚Äôarticolo ma senza nominarlo n√© fare riferimenti diretti.
L‚Äôarticolo contiene pi√π argomenti che devono essere integrati in un unico post coerente.

Scrivi un solo post LinkedIn di massimo 2000 caratteri.
Usa al massimo 5 o 6 emoji.

Il post deve:

- riassumere i concetti chiave

- esprimere una tua opinione

- stimolare la discussione

Evita spazi insensati e impagina il testo in modo ordinato.

I consigli devono essere unici e non gi√† presenti tra i contributi esistenti.

Dati disponibili:

Titolo articolo
{{ $json.ArticleTitle }}

Argomenti articolo
{{ $json.ArticleTopics }}

Altri contributi LinkedIn
{{ $json.ArticleContributions }}

Scrivi il post finale pronto per LinkedIn.
Non introdurre il testo e non spiegare cosa stai facendo.

options.systemMessage:
Sei un autore professionale di contenuti LinkedIn in lingua italiana.
Scrivi in modo chiaro, naturale e autentico.
Produci testi pronti per la pubblicazione, senza introduzioni o spiegazioni.

Rispetti sempre i limiti richiesti su lunghezza, struttura ed emoji.

Non usi markdown, non usi **, non inserisci caratteri speciali come / \ :.

Impagini il testo in modo leggibile e piacevole, con spazi sensati.

I contenuti devono essere originali, non ripetitivi e non sovrapponibili ad altri contributi esistenti.

Esprimi opinioni personali credibili e inviti alla discussione.

Scrivi esclusivamente in italiano corretto.

values.content:
=Trasforma il testo che ricevi in un prompt per la generazione di un‚Äôimmagine.

Testo di input: {{ $json.output }} 

‚ö†Ô∏è OUTPUT OBBLIGATORIO 
Devi restituire ESCLUSIVAMENTE un oggetto JSON valido, senza alcun testo prima o dopo. 

Non scrivere mai: "json", "text":, "output:"", spiegazioni o commenti.

Il risultato DEVE iniziare SEMPRE con "{" e finire con "}".

Struttura UNICA e OBBLIGATORIA:
{
"inputs": "prompt..."
}

Regole di formato (vincolanti):
- Il valore di inputs deve essere una sola stringa su una sola riga
- Non usare ritorni a capo
- Non usare apici singoli
- Non usare virgolette interne
- Non usare parentesi tonde o quadre
- Usa solo caratteri compatibili con JSON
- Non aggiungere chiavi diverse da inputs
- Non aggiungere testo fuori dal JSON

Regole di contenuto:

Mantieni il contenuto il pi√π possibile fedele al testo originale

Il prompt DEVE includere un titolo chiaro e coerente

Il titolo DEVE essere scritto in italiano corretto, senza errori grammaticali, di genere, numero o articoli

Se vengono citate nazioni o aziende, rappresentale visivamente

Stile visivo leggero, astratto, editoriale e naturale

Immagine non riconoscibile come AI

Usa elementi grafici sottili e tipografia discreta sullo sfondo

Evita volti, persone o soggetti umani centrali

Design minimal, elegante, professionale

‚ö†Ô∏è Se l‚Äôoutput non √® esattamente nel formato richiesto, √® da considerarsi errato.
